Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
utilities.InputHandler
public class InputHandler extends Object
Handles user inputs and provides validation for various fields such as username, name, dates, etc.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputHandler

      public InputHandler()

  • Method Details

    • UsernameInput

      public String UsernameInput()
      Prompts the user to enter a username, validates it, and checks for duplicates. The username must be between 4 and 15 characters, shouldn't have any spaces and match a specific pattern, shouldn't start with special characters If the username is valid, it is returned. If it is not valid the user is prompted again.
      Returns:
      A valid and unique username.

    • UsernameInputToOperate

      public String UsernameInputToOperate()
      Same function as @see #validateUsername(String) Prompts the user to enter a username without checking for duplicates.
      Returns:
      A valid username.

    • NameInput

      public String NameInput(String tempName)
      Prompts the user to enter a valid name and validates it using a regular expression. Name can consist of multiple words, containing only letters and single quotes If the name is valid it is returned, if not then user is prompted again.
      Parameters:
      tempName - A temporary name to ensure the new name is not the same.
      Returns:
      A valid name.

    • SurnameInput

      public String SurnameInput(String tempSurname)
      Prompts the user to enter a valid surname and validates it using a regular expression. Surname can consist of a single word with single quote containing only letters. If the surname is valid it is returned if not user is prompted again.
      Parameters:
      tempSurname - A temporary surname to ensure the new surname is not the same.
      Returns:
      A valid surname.

    • RoleInput

      public String RoleInput(String tempRole)
      Prompts the user to enter a role and validates it against a predefined set of roles. The valid roles are "manager", "engineer", "technician", and "intern". If the role is valid, it is returned; otherwise, the user is prompted again.
      Parameters:
      tempRole - A temporary role to ensure the new role is not the same.
      Returns:
      A valid role.

    • PhoneInput

      public String PhoneInput(String tempPhone)
      Prompts the user to enter a phone number and validates its format and uniqueness. The phone number has to follow a strict pattern of "+1XXXXXXXXXX" where X is a digit. If the phone number is valid it is returned if not the user is prompted again
      Parameters:
      tempPhone - A temporary phone number to ensure the new phone is not the same.
      Returns:
      A valid phone number.

    • DobInput

      public LocalDate DobInput(LocalDate tempDOB)
      Prompts the user to enter a date of birth and validates it. Date of birth checks if the user is above 18 and is not born before 1920. Also it checks if the new birthday is the same as the previosu birthday. If the date of birth is valid it is returned if not the user is prompted again
      Parameters:
      tempDOB - A temporary date of birth to ensure the new DOB is not the same.
      Returns:
      A valid date of birth.

    • DosInput

      public LocalDate DosInput(LocalDate tempDOS)
      Prompts the user to enter a start date and validates it to ensure it is not in the future. New date of start can not be the same as the previous date of start. If the date of start is valid it is returned if not user is prompted again
      Parameters:
      tempDOS - A temporary date of start to ensure the new date is not the same.
      Returns:
      A valid start date.

    • DoesDatesMakeSense

      public boolean DoesDatesMakeSense(LocalDate DOB, LocalDate DOS)
      Validates that the start date is after the date of birth.
      Parameters:
      DOB - The date of birth.
      DOS - The date of start.
      Returns:
      True if the start date is after the date of birth, false otherwise.

    • EmailInput

      public String EmailInput(String tempEmail)
      Prompts the user to enter an email address and validates it for proper format and uniqueness. If the email is valid it is returned if not the user is prompted again.
      Parameters:
      tempEmail - A temporary email to ensure the new email is not the same.
      Returns:
      A valid email address.

    • WannaReturn

      public boolean WannaReturn(Scanner input)
      Asks the user if they want to return to the main menu. Validates the users input to make sure they choose either '1' for yes or '2' for no
      Parameters:
      input - The Scanner object for user input.
      Returns:
      True if the user chooses to return to the main menu, false otherwise.

    • WannaAbort

      public boolean WannaAbort(Scanner input)
      Asks the user if they want to proceed with firing an employee. Displays a warning message and validates the user's input to ensure they choose either '1' for yes or '2' for no.
      Parameters:
      input - The Scanner object for user input.
      Returns:
      True if the user chooses to return to the main menu, false otherwise.

    • UpdateInput

      public void UpdateInput(String username)
      Handles updating employee information based on the user's input. Displays a menu of fields to update and processes the user's selection. Ensures that the user cannot update their own information and verifies that the employee exists in the database.

    • Ccleaner

      public static void Ccleaner()
      Clears the console screen. This method attempts to clear the console by running a system command. If an error occurs during the process, an error message is printed.
